## Plant evolution tied to atmospheric shifts in CO~2~:O~2~ 
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:170px; LEFT:125px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/evolution_rubisco.jpg">

## Why has Rubsico not been replaced?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">
* **Evolution of enzymes subject to strong biophysical constraints**
    * trade-offs between activity and stability
 
 <br/>
 
* **Removing the oxygenation capability breaks rubisco**
    * selection against modifying mutations

<br/>

* **RubisCO → RubisC**
    * requires a decrease in fitness 
    * "heartbeat" of photosynthesis

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:275px; LEFT:550px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/rubisco_mutations.jpg">

<br/>

## C4 photosynthesis: Evolved many times
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:200px; LEFT:175px; WIDTH:700px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c4map.png">

## Evolution of C4 photosynthesis
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 53%;">

* **C3 plants use CO~2~ directly in the Calvin cycle**

<br/>

* **C4 plants first fix CO~2~ to PEP**

<br/>

* **Mesophyll cells @ top are CO~2~ pumps**
    * flood Rubsico in **bundle sheath cells** with CO~2~

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:350px" SRC="images/c3vsc4.jpg">

## Functional change in bundle sheath cells (C3 → C4)
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:275px; LEFT:550px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:250px" SRC="images/c3_c4_anatomy.png"

<div style="float: right; left: 45%;">

* **Calvin cycle now occurs in BSC cells around leaf veins**
    * chloroplasts now present

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

* **BSC cells are less permeable to gases**
    * what does this mean for photorespiration?

</div>

## 

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:25px; LEFT:250px; WIDTH:600px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/c3_cs.gif">

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:375px; LEFT:250px; WIDTH:600px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/c4_cs.gif">

## C4 plants concentrate CO~2~ around Rubisco spatially
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 55%;">

* **C4 mechanism separates Calvin cycle from high O~2~**

<br/>

* **New enzyme, phosphoenolpyruvate carboxlylase (PEPC)**
    * fixes CO~2~ to PEP
    * no affinity for O~2~
    * 4C malate carries CO~2~ to Calvin cycle

<br/>

* **Hyper efficient with use of CO~2~**
    * How does this impact stomata behavior?

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:215px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c4.jpg">

## Why is C4 photosynthesis not dominant?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 50%;">

* **Regeneration of PEP expensive (ATP)**
 
<br/>
 
* **Where is needed ATP generated?**

<br/>

* **Where should C4 plants live**
    * efficiency vs dehydration
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:185px; LEFT:100px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/c4_2.jpg">

##
<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:50px; LEFT:150px; WIDTH:800px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/c4_distribution.jpg">

<div class="item-absolute2"> In hot conditions, the benefits of reduced photorespiration likely exceed the ATP cost of moving CO~2~ from the mesophyll cell to the bundle-sheath cell </div>

## CAM (Crassulacean Acid Metabolism) photosynthesis
<hr>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:175px; LEFT:250px; WIDTH:600px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/cam2.png">

## CAM concentrates CO~2~ around Rubisco temporally
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: right; width: 47%;">

* **Stomata open at night only**
 
<br/>
 
* **4C compounds produced in large quantities**
    + store CO~2~ when Rubisco is inactive

<br/>

* **C4 vs CAM**
    * substitute BSC for "night shift"
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:225px; LEFT:50px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/cam5.jpg">
